title: VO2 max
summary: V̇O2 max (also maximal oxygen consumption, maximal oxygen uptake or maximal aerobic capacity) is the maximum rate of oxygen consumption measured during incremental exercise; that is, exercise of increasing intensity.[1][2] The name is derived from three abbreviations: "V̇" for volume (the dot  appears over the V to indicate "per unit of time"), "O2" for oxygen, and "max" for maximum.
